subclause.xt:author: Lee Liu
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The flow rate must be calculated by determining the greater of—

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li: probable simultaneous flow rate in accordance with (3); or
flow rate of a single fixture with the largest flow rate downstream of the pipework section.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: For a specific pipe section, the probable simultaneous flow rate must be calculated in accordance with the following equation:
where­—

callout.xt:author: Lee Liu
callout.title: Fixture flow rates
callout.p: The velocity limit defined by B1P2 is an upper limit value and does not necessarily represent a suitable velocity for water service components, equipment, and pipework materials. Confirmation should be sought on suitable velocities for the products and any specific design and installation criteria.

It is recognised that not all water service components are selected based on the 99th percentile flowrate. The practitioner must ensure appropriate use of B1V1(3) when selecting components using the 99th percentile flowrate.
Fixture flowrates can be determined based on the type selected for a particular project.

callout.xt:author: Lee Liu
callout.title: Building size and occupancy
callout.p: Research has shown the probability of fixture use is dependent on building size and occupancy. The following parameters are built into probability of fixture use equations:

ul.xt:author: Lee Liu
ul.li: Building occupancy (estimated number of occupants) drawing water downstream from the subject pipe section.

callout.p: Consideration should be given to the anticipated occupancy for each apartment building. Where the building occupancy is not known, the number of bedrooms for each dwelling can be used as an indicator of the anticipated building occupancy. Statistics on average building occupancy may be utilised to make informed assumptions.

Values in Table B1V1 are derived from fixture use characteristics considering the results presented in several relevant Australian residential end-use studies that have monitored fixture usage in detached residential dwellings.
